text: hi everyone it's always good to have an
easy cookie recipe on hand and today I'm
sharing one of my favorites
these are zesty tangy crispy glazed
lemon cookies I'll start with my dry
ingredients so here I have 2 cups of
all-purpose flour and to that I'm adding
1 tablespoon of grated lemon zest I'm
using a microplane grater to do this and
it's about the zest of one lemon I like
to zest with my microplane facing up
because then it catches all of it and it
doesn't get messy all over your board
you're not losing anything just kind of
a handy little trick and a microplane is
kind of like having something with a
little blade on it and so you don't want
to put these in the dishwasher because
look it to be a little bit dull so it's
good to hand wash these perfect so I'll
add lemon zest to my flour and next I'm
adding 1/2 TSP of kosher salt and 1/2
teaspoon of baking soda
give this a quick whisk you can already
smell the lemon zest it's such a nice
fragrant smell all right that looks
combined and next I'm moving on to my
wet ingredients so I have a stick of
room-temperature butter it's not I'm
adding 1 cup of granulated sugar get
this going on medium-high until it's
light and fluffy which takes a couple of
minutes
well that's next thing I'm gonna go
ahead and juice my lemon so I need two
tablespoons of lemon juice
these squeezers are really handy for
doing the job we don't get any of the
seeds in there you know every lemons a
little different some of them have a
little more juice than others depending
on how thick their skin is so I'll just
give this a quick scrape so I'm adding
one room-temperature egg having the egg
room temperature helps it emulsify into
the butter mixture let that go I'm
medium for a minute
and then one teaspoon of pure vanilla
extract let that makes one more time
go ahead and add my two tablespoons of
freshly squeezed lemon juice
and this off give it another scrape
around the edges make sure it's all
combined and add the dry ingredients
that last a little bit in there now just
mix this on low for a couple minutes
until it's just combined all right great
super easy dough it's already done so
here I have prepared my baking sheets
with parchment paper and I have a
tablespoon size cookie scoop you can
also use just a normal tablespoon
measure or a small spoon whatever you
have in your house works just great this
is nice because it gets all the cookies
to be the same size so you're just gonna
drop these about an inch apart onto our
prepared baking sheet my oven is
preheated at 350 degrees definitely good
to do that ahead of time so you're not
waiting for the oven to preheat I love
these drop cookies because they're so
easy as you've seen
[Music]
so now these little cookies are ready
for the oven they're going in at 350
degrees for 15 minutes until they're
nice and golden around the edge so I've
taken my cookies out of the oven don't
these look so good and I let them cool
for a couple minutes on the baking sheet
and then I removed them just let them
cool completely on a wire rack and now
they're ready to go so I'm gonna make my
glaze this is two cups of confectioner's
sugar and to that I'm adding a third of
a cup of freshly squeezed lemon juice
and two tablespoons of lemon zest a lot
more potent lemon flavor so just give
this a quick whisk I'm sure you whisk
all the little lumps of sugar out I
think that's good and now I'll take my
cookie and since it's a pretty thin
glaze I'm just gonna dip it right in let
them drip off a little bit and then I'm
putting them right back onto the wire
rack to catch any drips and I have
parchment under the wire rack so that I
don't get my counter all messy you can
just throw it away when you're done just
like that it's so easy I love these
little cookies they are the perfect
combination of sweet and sour I think
these are gonna be a really fun cookie
to have at your next party I got to try
one of these they're so simple
they're bright they have a little bit of
that fresh bite from the lemon zest I
think you're really gonna like these
